FuncDef:
The domain-id command sets an OSPFv3 domain ID.
The undo domain-id command restores the default setting. The domain-id command sets an OSPFv3 domain ID. The undo domain-id command restores the default setting. By default, the domain ID is null. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the OSPFv3 domain ID to null.
-

Specifies the ID of an OSPF domain as an integer.
It is an integer, the value ranges from 0 to 4294967295. The value is converted to dotted decimal notation (with 256 as a carry) when the ID is displayed.

Specifies the ID of an OSPF domain as an IP address.
It is in dotted decimal notation, it is displayed as entered.

Specifies the value of the OSPFv3 domain ID type.
The value is a hexadecimal number ranging from 0 to FFFF, and the default value is 0.

Indicates the ID of a secondary domain.
-
